SourceProxy.name: GlyphSource2D
SourceProxy.label: 2D Glyph

Documentation.long_help: Create a 2D glyph (e.g., arrow, cross, dash, etc.)
Documentation.short_help: Create a 2D glyph

SourceProxy.Documentation: The 2D Glyph source is used for generating a family of 2D glyphs, each of which lies in the x-y plane. The output of the 2D Glyph source is polygonal data.

IntVectorProperty.name: GlyphType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the type of the 2D glyph.

IntVectorProperty.name: Filled
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is 1, the 2D glyph will be a filled polygon; otherwise, only the edges (line segments) will be included in the output. This only applies to closed 2D glyphs.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Center
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the x, y, z coordinates of the origin of the 2D glyph.

SourceProxy.name: VectorText
SourceProxy.label: 3D Text

Documentation.long_help: 3D geometric representation of a text string
Documentation.short_help: Create a 3D text object

SourceProxy.Documentation: The 3D Text source displays a text string as polygonal data.

StringVectorProperty.name: Text
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text string to be displayed. The ASCII alphanumeric characters a-z, A-Z, and 0-9 are supported; so are ASCII punctuation marks. The only supported control character is "\n", which inserts a new line in the text string.

SourceProxy.name: ArrowSource
SourceProxy.label: Arrow

Documentation.long_help: 3D arrow with a long cylindrical shaft and a cone for the tip
Documentation.short_help: Create a 3D arrow

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Arrow source appends a cylinder to a cone to form a 3D arrow. The length of the whole arrow is 1.0 unit. The output of the Arrow source is polygonal data. This polygonal data will not contain normals, so rendering of the arrow will be performed using flat shading. The appearance of the arrow can be improved without significantly increasing the resolution of the tip and shaft by generating normals. (Use Normals Generation filter).

IntVectorProperty.name: TipResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the number of faces in the representation of the tip of the arrow (the cone). As the resolution increases, the cone will become smoother.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TipRadius
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the radius of the widest part of the tip of the arrow (the cone).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TipLength
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the length of the tip.

IntVectorProperty.name: ShaftResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the number of faces of the shaft of the arrow (the cylinder). As the resolution increases, the cylinder will become smoother.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ShaftRadius
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the radius of the shaft of the arrow (the cylinder).

SourceProxy.name: Axes
SourceProxy.label: Axes

Documentation.long_help: Three lines representing the axes - red line along X, green line along Y, and blue line along Z
Documentation.short_help: Create three lines representing X, Y and Z axes

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Axes source can be used to add a representation of the coordinate system axes to the 3D scene. The X axis will be drawn as a blue line, the Y axis as a green line, and the Z axis as a red line. The axes can be drawn either as three lines drawn in the positive direction from the origin or as three lines crossing at the origin (drawn in both the positive and negative directions). The output of the Axes source is polygonal data. This polygonal data has a scalar per line so that the lines can be colored. It also has normals defined.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ScaleFactor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: By default the axes lines have a length of 1 (or 1 in each direction, for a total length of 2, if value of the Symmetric property is 1). Increasing or decreasing the value of this property will make the axes larger or smaller, respectively.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Origin
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property set the X, Y, and Z coordinates of the origin of the axes.

IntVectorProperty.name: Symmetric
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When this property is set to 1, the axes extend along each of the positive and negative directions for a distance equal to the value of the Scale Factor property. When set to 0, the axes extend only in the positive direction.

SourceProxy.name: OutlineSource
SourceProxy.label: Outline

Documentation.long_help: 3D outline of the specified bounds.
Documentation.short_help: Create an outline from the bounds

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Outline source creates an axis aligned bounding box given the user-specified minimum and maximum coordinates for each axis.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Bounds
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property specify the minimum and maximum X, Y, and Z coordinates (X min, X max, Y min, Y max, Z min, Z max) for drawing the outline.

SourceProxy.name: CubeSource
SourceProxy.label: Box

Documentation.short_help: 3D box with specified X, Y, and Z lengths
Documentation.long_help: Create a box with specified X, Y, and Z lengths.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Box source can be used to add a box to the 3D scene. The output of the Box source is polygonal data containing both normals and texture coordinates.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: XLength
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the length of the box in the X direction.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: YLength
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the length of the box in the Y direction.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ZLength
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the length of the box in the Z direction.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Center
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the center of the box.

SourceProxy.name: ConeSource
SourceProxy.label: Cone

Documentation.short_help: 3D cone of a given radius and height
Documentation.long_help: Create a 3D cone of a given radius and height.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Cone source can be used to add a polygonal cone to the 3D scene. The output of the Cone source is polygonal data.

IntVectorProperty.name: Resolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates the number of divisions around the cone. The higher this number, the closer the polygonal approximation will come to representing a cone, and the more polygons it will contain.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Radius
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the radius of the base of the cone.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Height
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the height of the cone.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Center
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the center of the cone.

IntVectorProperty.name: Capping
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this property is set to 1, the base of the cone will be capped with a filled polygon. Otherwise, the base of the cone will be open.

SourceProxy.name: HierarchicalFractal
SourceProxy.label: Hierarchical Fractal

Documentation.long_help: Test source for AMR with HierarchicalDataSet
Documentation.short_help: Hierarchical fractal

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Hierarchical Fractal source is a collection of uniform grids. All have the same dimensions. Each block has a different origin and spacing. This source uses the Mandelbrot source to create cell data. The fractal array is scaled to look like a volme fraction.

IntVectorProperty.name: Dimensions
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the X, Y, Z cell dimensions of a block.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: FractalValue
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property will be mapped to 0.5 for use as a volume fraction.

IntVectorProperty.name: MaximumLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies how many levels of refinement should be included in this hierarchical dataset.

IntVectorProperty.name: GhostLevels
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies whether ghost levels should be generated at processor boundaries.

IntVectorProperty.name: TwoDimensional
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this property is set to 1, the generated dataset will be 2D; otherwise it will be 3D.

IntVectorProperty.name: Asymetric
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this property is set to 0, all the blocks will be the same size. If it is set to 1, an asymmetric dataset will be created: some blocks will have an X dimension that is larger by 2 units.

IntVectorProperty.name: RectilinearGrids
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this property is set to 1, the hierarchical dataset will contain rectilinear grids; otherwise it will contain uniform grids.

IntVectorProperty.name: TimeStep
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the timestep to use for this dataset.

SourceProxy.name: CylinderSource
SourceProxy.label: Cylinder

Documentation.short_help: 3D cylinder of a given radius and height
Documentation.long_help: Create a 3D cylinder of a given radius and height.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Cylinder source can be used to add a polygonal cylinder to the 3D scene. The output of the Cylinder source is polygonal data containing both normals and texture coordinates.

IntVectorProperty.name: Resolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates the number of divisions around the cylinder. The higher this number, the closer the polygonal approximation will come to representing a cylinder, and the more polygons it will contain.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Height
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the height of the cylinder (along the y axis).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Radius
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the radius of the cylinder.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Center
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the coordinate value at the center of the cylinder.

IntVectorProperty.name: Capping
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this property is set to 1, the ends of the cylinder will each be capped with a closed polygon. Otherwise, the ends of the cylinder will be open.

SourceProxy.name: LineSource
SourceProxy.label: Line

Documentation.long_help: This source creates a line between two points. The resolution indicates how many segments are in the line.
Documentation.short_help: Create a line between two points

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Line source can be used to interactively (using a 3D widget) or manually (using the entries on the user interface) add a line to the 3D scene. The output of the Line source is polygonal data.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Point1
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls the coordinates of the first endpoint of the line.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Point2
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls the coordinates of the second endpoint of the line.

IntVectorProperty.name: Resolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the number of pieces into which to divide the line.

SourceProxy.name: Ruler
SourceProxy.label: Ruler

Documentation.long_help: This is a line source that can be used to measure distance between two points
Documentation.short_help: Create a ruler

SourceProxy.Documentation: The ruler can be used to interactively (using a 3D widget) or manually (using the entries on the user interface) specify two points and then determine the distance between the two points. To place points on the surface of any dataset, one can use the 'p' key shortcut.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Point1
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls the coordinates of the first endpoint of the line.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Point2
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls the coordinates of the second endpoint of the line.

SourceProxy.name: ImageMandelbrotSource
SourceProxy.label: Mandelbrot

Documentation.long_help: Representation (unsigned char) of the Mandlebrot set in up to 3 dimensions
Documentation.short_help: Create a Mandelbrot representation

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Mandelbrot source can be used to add a uniform rectilinear grid with scalar values derived from the Mandelbrot set to the 3D scene. The equation used is z = z^2 + C (where z and C are complex, and C is a constant). The scalar values in the grid are the number of iterations of the equation it takes for the magnitude of the value to become greater than 2. In the equation, the initial value of z is 0. By default, the real component of C is mapped onto the X axis; the imaginary component of C is mapped onto the Y axis; and the imaginary component of the initial value is mapped onto the Z axis. If a two-dimensional extent is specified, the resulting image will be displayed. If a three-dimensional extent is used, then the bounding box of the volume will be displayed. The output of the Mandelbrot source is image (uniform rectilinear) data.

IntVectorProperty.name: WholeExtent
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The six values in the property indicate the X, Y, and Z extent of the output data. The first two numbers are the minimum and maximum X extent; the next two are the minimum and maximum Y extent; and the final two are the minimum and maximum Z extent. The numbers are inclusive, so values of 0, 250, 0, 250, 0, 0 indicate that the dimensions of the output will be 251 x 251 x 1.

IntVectorProperty.name: ProjectionAxes
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The three values in this property allow you to specify the projection from the 4D space used by the Mandelbrot set to the axes of the 3D volume. By default, the real component of C (represented by 0) is mapped to the X axis; the imaginary component of C (represented by 1) is mapped to the Y axis; and the real component of X, the initial value (represented by 2) is mapped to the Z axis. The imaginary component of X is represented by 3. All values entered must be between 0 and 3, inclusive.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: OriginCX
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The four values of this property indicate (in order) the components of C (real and imaginary) and the components of the initial value, X (real and imaginary).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: SizeCX
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The four values of this property indicate the length of the output in each of the four dimensions (the real and imaginary components of C and the real and imaginary components of X). The three dimensions specified in the Projection Axes property will determine which of these values specify the length of the axes in the output.

IntVectorProperty.name: MaximumNumberOfIterations
IntVectorProperty.label: Maximum Number of Iterations
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property specifies the limit on computational iterations (i.e., the maximum number of iterations to perform to determine if the value will go above 2). Values less than 2.0 after the specified number of iterations are considered in the fractal set.

IntVectorProperty.name: SubsampleRate
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the rate at which to subsample the volume. The extent of the dataset in each dimension will be divided by this value.

SourceProxy.name: OctreeFractal
SourceProxy.label: Octree Fractal

Documentation.long_help: Test source for octree with Mandelbrot fractal
Documentation.short_help: Octree Fractal

SourceProxy.Documentation: Create an octree from a Mandelbrot fractal. See the Mandelbrot source for a description of the variables used.

IntVectorProperty.name: Dimension
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the dimensionality of the fractal: 1D - Binary tree line, 2D - Quadtree plane, 3D - Octree volume.

IntVectorProperty.name: MaximumLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum refinement level for the grid.

IntVectorProperty.name: MinimumLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the minimum refinement level for the grid.

IntVectorProperty.name: ProjectionAxes
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates which axes of the dataset to display. See Mandelbrot source for a description of the possible axes.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: OriginCX
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the imaginary and real values for C (constant) and X (initial value). See Mandelbrot source for a description of the C and X variables.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: SizeCX
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The four values of this property indicate the length of the output in each of the four dimensions (the real and imaginary components of C and the real and imaginary components of X). The three dimensions specified in the Projection Axes property will determine which of these values specify the length of the axes in the output.

IntVectorProperty.name: MaximumNumberOfIterations
IntVectorProperty.label: Maximum Number of Iterations
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property specifies the limit on computational iterations (i.e., the maximum number of iterations to perform to determine if the value will go above 2). Values less than 2.0 after the specified number of iterations are considered in the fractal set.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Threshold
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies a threshold value that determines when to subdivide a leaf node.

SourceProxy.name: PlaneSource
SourceProxy.label: Plane

Documentation.long_help: Create a parallelogram given an origin and two points. The resolution indicates the number of division along each axis of the plane.
Documentation.short_help: Create a parallelogram from an origin and two points

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Plane source can be used to add a polygonal parallelogram to the 3D scene. Unlike the sphere, cone, and cylinder sources, the parallelogram is exactly represented at the lowest resolution, but higher resolutions may be desired if this plane is to be used as an input to a filter. The output of the Plane source is polygonal data.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Origin
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinate of the origin (one corner) of the plane.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Point1
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinate a second corner of the parallelogram. The line connecting this point and that specified by the Origin property define one edge of the parallelogram (its X axis).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Point2
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinate a third corner of the parallelogram. The line connecting this point and that specified by the Origin property define a second edge of the parallelogram (its Y axis).

IntVectorProperty.name: XResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the number of divisions along the X axis of the parallelogram.

IntVectorProperty.name: YResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the number of divisions along the Y axis of the parallelogram.

SourceProxy.name: PointSource
SourceProxy.label: Point Source

Documentation.long_help: Create a point cloud of a certain size, radius, and center.
Documentation.short_help: Create a point cloud

SourceProxy.Documentation: The point source creates a specified number of points within a given radius about a specified center point.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Center
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinates of the center of the point cloud.

IntVectorProperty.name: NumberOfPoints
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the number of points in the point cloud.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Radius
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the radius of the point cloud, measured from the value of the Center property.

SourceProxy.name: SphereSource
SourceProxy.label: Sphere

Documentation.long_help: Create a 3D sphere given a center and radius.
Documentation.short_help: Create a 3D sphere

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Sphere source can be used to add a polygonal sphere to the 3D scene. The output of the Sphere source is polygonal data with point normals defined.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Center
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinates for the center of the sphere.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Radius
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the radius of the sphere.

IntVectorProperty.name: ThetaResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property represents the number of divisions between Start Theta and End Theta around the sphere. (See the Start Theta and End Theta properties.) The theta divisions are similar to longitude lines on the earth. The higher the resolution, the closer the approximation will come to a sphere, and the more polygons there will be.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: StartTheta
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: To form a complete sphere, the value of this property should be 0 degrees, and the value of the End Theta property should be 360 degrees. The value of this property can be adjusted to form only a portion of a sphere.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: EndTheta
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property can be adjusted to form only a portion of a sphere. This value is measured in degrees.

IntVectorProperty.name: PhiResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property represents the number of divisions between Start Phi and End Phi on the sphere. (See the Start Phi and End Phi properties.) The phi divisions are similar to latitude lines on the earth.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: StartPhi
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: To form a complete sphere, the value of this property should be 0 degrees, and the value of the End Phi property should be 180 degrees. The value of this property can be adjusted to form only a portion of a sphere. Set the starting angle (in degrees) in the latitudinal direction.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: EndPhi
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property can be adjusted to form only a portion of a sphere. The value is measured in degrees.

SourceProxy.name: SuperquadricSource
SourceProxy.label: Superquadric

Documentation.long_help: Create a superquadric according to the theta and phi roundness parameters. This one source can generate a wide variety of 3D objects including a box, a sphere, or a torus.
Documentation.short_help: Create a superquadric according to the theta and phi roundness parameters

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Superquadric source can be used to add a polygonal superquadric to the 3D scene. This source can be used to create a wide variety of shapes (e.g., a sphere, a box, or a torus) by adjusting the roundness parameters. The output of the Superquadric source is polygonal data with point normals and texture coordinates defined.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Center
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinates of the center of the superquadric.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Scale
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The three values in this property are used to scale the superquadric in X, Y, and Z. The surface normals will be computed correctly even with anisotropic scaling.

IntVectorProperty.name: ThetaResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property represents the number of divisions in the theta (longitudinal) direction. This value will be rounded to the nearest multiple of 8.

IntVectorProperty.name: PhiResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property represents the number of divisions in the phi (latitudinal) direction. This number will be rounded to the nearest multiple of 4.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Thickness
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of the Toroidal property is 1, this value represents the thickness of the superquadric as a value between 0 and 1. A value close to 0 leads to a thin object with a large hole, and a value near 1 leads to a thick object with a very small hole. Changing the thickness does not change the outer radius of the superquadric.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ThetaRoundness
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property defines the roundness of the superquadric in the theta (longitudinal) direction. A value of 0 represents a rectangular shape, a value of 1 represents a circular shape, and values greater than 1 produce higher order shapes.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: PhiRoundness
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property defines the roundness in the phi (latitudinal) direction. A value of 0 represents a rectangular shape, a value of 1 represents a circular shape, and values greater than 1 produce higher order shapes.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Size
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property represents the isotropic size of the superquadric. Note that both the Size and Thickness properties control coefficients of superquadric generation, so the value of this property may not exactly describe the size of the superquadric.

IntVectorProperty.name: Toroidal
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is 0, the generated superquadric will not contain a hole (i.e., the superquadric will be ellipsoidal). Otherwise, a toroidal object is generated.

SourceProxy.name: RTAnalyticSource
SourceProxy.label: Wavelet

Documentation.long_help: Create a regular rectilinear grid in up to three dimensions with values varying according to a periodic function.
Documentation.short_help: Create a rectilinear grid containing a wavelet

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Wavelet source can be used to create a uniform rectilinear grid in up to three dimensions with values varying according to the following periodic function. OS = M * G * (XM * sin(XF * x) + YM * sin(YF * y) + ZM * cos(ZF * z)) OS is the output scalar; M represents the maximum value; G represents the Gaussian; XM, YM, and ZM are the X, Y, and Z magnitude values; and XF, YF, and ZF are the X, Y, and Z frequency values. If a two-dimensional extent is specified, the resulting image will be displayed. If a three-dimensional extent is used, then the bounding box of the volume will be displayed.

IntVectorProperty.name: WholeExtent
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The six values in this property indicate the X, Y, and Z extent of the output data. The first two values represent the minimum and maximum X indices, the next two are the minimum and maximum Y indices, and the last two are the minimum and maximum Z indices.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Center
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinates of the center of the dataset.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Maximum
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This parameter specifies the maximum value (M) of the function.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: XFreq
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the natural frequency in X (XF in the equation).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: YFreq
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the natural frequency in Y (YF in the equation).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ZFreq
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the natural frequency in Z (ZF in the equation).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: XMag
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the wave amplitude in X (XM in the equation).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: YMag
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the wave amplitude in Y (YM in the equation).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ZMag
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the wave amplitude in Z (ZM in the equation).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: StandardDeviation
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the standard deviation of the Gaussian used in computing this function.

IntVectorProperty.name: SubsampleRate
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the rate at which to subsample the volume. The extent of the dataset in each dimension will be divided by this value. (See the Whole Extent property.)

IntVectorProperty.name: Resolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the number of faces used to generate the cone.

SourceProxy.name: TextSource
SourceProxy.label: Text

Documentation.short_help: Display text
Documentation.long_help: The Text source generates a table containing text.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Text source is used to generate a 1x1 vtkTable with a single text string.

StringVectorProperty.name: Text
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the text to display.

Proxy.name: SelectionSourceBase
Proxy.Documentation: Internal proxy used to define the common API for Selection Source proxies. Do not use.

IntVectorProperty.name: FieldType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The location of the array the selection came from (ex, point, cell).

IntVectorProperty.name: ContainingCells
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When field type is POINT, this controls whether single vertex cells will be produced for each selected point, or whether the cells that contain each selected point will be produced. When field type is CELL this has no effect.

IntVectorProperty.name: InsideOut
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When this property is false the selection describes everything that should be extracted. When this is true the selection describes everything that should NOT be extracted.

SourceProxy.name: BlockSelectionSource
SourceProxy.Documentation: BlockSelectionSource is a source producing a block-based selection used to select blocks from a composite dataset.

IdTypeVectorProperty.name: Blocks
IdTypeVectorProperty.label: Blocks
IdTypeVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of blocks that will be added to the selection produced by the selection source. The blocks are identified using their composite index (flat index).

SourceProxy.name: FrustumSelectionSource
SourceProxy.Documentation: FrustumSelectionSource is a source producing a frustum selection.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Frustum
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Frustum
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Vertices that define a frustum for the selection source.

SourceProxy.name: GlobalIDSelectionSource
SourceProxy.Documentation: GlobalIDSelectionSource is a source producing a global ID based selection.

IdTypeVectorProperty.name: IDs
IdTypeVectorProperty.label: Global IDs
IdTypeVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of IDs that will be added to the selection produced by the selection source.

SourceProxy.name: PedigreeIDSelectionSource
SourceProxy.Documentation: PedigreeIDSelectionSource is a source producing a pedigree ID based selection.

StringVectorProperty.name: IDs
StringVectorProperty.label: Pedigree IDs
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of IDs that will be added to the selection produced by the selection source, specified by the pair (domain, id).

SourceProxy.name: IDSelectionSource
SourceProxy.Documentation: IDSelectionSource is a source producing a ID based selection. This cannot be used for selecting composite datasets.

IdTypeVectorProperty.name: IDs
IdTypeVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of IDs that will be added to the selection produced by the selection source. This takes pairs of values as (process number, id).

SourceProxy.name: CompositeDataIDSelectionSource
SourceProxy.Documentation: CompositeDataIDSelectionSource used to create an ID based selection for composite datasets (Multiblock or HierarchicalBox dataset).

IdTypeVectorProperty.name: IDs
IdTypeVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of IDs that will be added to the selection produced by the selection source. This takes 3-tuple of values as (flat-index, process number, id).

SourceProxy.name: HierarchicalDataIDSelectionSource
SourceProxy.Documentation: HierarchicalDataIDSelectionSource used to create an ID based selection for HierarchicalBox datasets.

IdTypeVectorProperty.name: IDs
IdTypeVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of IDs that will be added to the selection produced by the selection source. This takes 3-tuple of values as (level, index, id).

SourceProxy.name: ThresholdSelectionSource
SourceProxy.Documentation: ThresholdSelectionSource is used to create a threshold based selection.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Thresholds
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of thresholds that will be added to the selection produced by the selection source.

SourceProxy.name: LocationSelectionSource
SourceProxy.Documentation: LocationSelectionSource is used to create a location based selection.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Locations
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of locations that will be added to the selection produced by the selection source.

SourceProxy.name: TimeToTextConvertorSource
SourceProxy.label: Annotate Time

Documentation.short_help: Show animation time as text
Documentation.long_help: Shows the animation time as text annnotation in the view.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Annotate Time source can be used to show the animation time in text annotation.

StringVectorProperty.name: Format
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the format used to display the input time (using printf style).

SourceProxy.name: TimeSource
SourceProxy.label: Time Source

Documentation.long_help: Produces a single cell uniform grid with data values that vary over a sin(t) wave from t=0 to t=1 (radian).
Documentation.short_help: Produces a sine wave over time

SourceProxy.Documentation: Produces a single cell uniform grid with data values that vary over a sin(t) wave from t=0 to t=1 (radian).

IntVectorProperty.name: Analytic
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Makes the time source produce discrete steps of or an analytic sin wave.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: X Amplitude
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls how far the data set moves along X over time.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Y Amplitude
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls how far the data set moves along Y over time.

IntVectorProperty.name: Growing
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Makes the time source grow and shrink along Y over time.

SourceProxy.name: DataObjectGenerator
SourceProxy.label: Data Object Generator

Documentation.long_help: Parses a string to produce composite data objects consisting of simple templated datasets.
Documentation.short_help: Produces simple (composite or atomic) data sets for testing.

SourceProxy.Documentation: vtkDataObjectGenerator parses a string and produces dataobjects from the dataobject template names it sees in the string. For example, if the string contains "ID1" the generator will create a vtkImageData. "UF1", "RD1", "SD1", "PD1", and "UG1" will produce vtkUniformGrid, vtkRectilinearGrid, vtkStructuredGrid, vtkPolyData and vtkUnstructuredGrid respectively. You can compose composite datasets from the atomic ones listed above by putting them between "(" and ")" in the string to create groups, and then placing a collection of groups together inside one of the three composite dataset identifiers - "MB{}", "HD<>" or "HB[]". "HB[ (UF1)(UF1)(UF1) ]" will create a vtkHierarchicalBoxDataSet representing an octree, in which the firstmost cell is refined, and then the firstmost refined cell is refined itself. "HD< (UG1UG1UG1) (PD1)>" will create a vtkHierachicalDataSet which contains two refinement levels, the first is a group with three unstructured grids, the second, more refined level is a vtkPolyData. "MB{ (ID1)(PD1 RG1)(MB{}) }" will create a vtkMultiBlockDataSet consisting of three groups. The first group has one data set, a vtkImageData. The second group has two datasets, a vtkPolyData and a vtkRectilinearGrid. The third contains a vtkMultiBlockDataSet, which in this case is empty.

StringVectorProperty.name: Program
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the string that is parsed to determine the structured of the output data object to produce.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the name of image file to load.

IntVectorProperty.name: SourceProcess
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the process on which the image is available.
